name: Arch Linux Codespace with Dockerfile
postStartCommand:
echo "Attempting to configure Git. GIT_COMMITTER_NAME='${GIT_COMMITTER_NAME}', GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL='${GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL}'"
CURRENT_GIT_USER=$(git config --global --get user.name)
CURRENT_GIT_EMAIL=$(git config --global --get user.email)
echo "Current git config user.name='${CURRENT_GIT_USER}', user.email='${CURRENT_GIT_EMAIL}'"
if [ -z "${GIT_COMMITTER_NAME}" ] || [ -z "${GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL}" ]; then
  echo 'Warning: GIT_COMMITTER_NAME or GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL is empty. Cannot automatically configure Git identity from these. Attempting gh auth setup-git.'
  if command -v gh >/dev/null && gh auth status >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo 'GitHub CLI is installed and authenticated. Running gh auth setup-git...'
    gh auth setup-git
    echo "Git config after gh auth setup-git: user.name='$(git config --global user.name)', user.email='$(git config --global user.email)'"
  else
    echo 'Warning: GitHub CLI not available or not authenticated. Please configure git manually: git config --global user.name \"Your Name\" && git config --global user.email \"you@example.com\"'
  fi
elif [ -z "${CURRENT_GIT_USER}" ] || [ -z "${CURRENT_GIT_EMAIL}" ] || [ "${CURRENT_GIT_USER}" != "${GIT_COMMITTER_NAME}" ] || [ "${CURRENT_GIT_EMAIL}" != "${GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL}" ]; then
  echo 'Configuring Git user name and email using Codespaces environment variables...'
  git config --global user.name "${GIT_COMMITTER_NAME}"
  git config --global user.email "${GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL}"
  echo "Git configured with user: $(git config --global user.name), email: $(git config --global user.email)"
else
  echo 'Git user name and email already configured and match GIT_COMMITTER variables.'
fi
echo 'Final git config:'
git config --global --list | grep user
